Package SudokuBoardGenerator

Class SudokuGen

  • java.lang.Object
    • SudokuBoardGenerator.SudokuGen
  • public class SudokuGen
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all methods required to generate a completed and valid Sudoku board in the form of a 2D array

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int[][] board
      The uninitialised 2D array that represents the Sudoku board
      private boolean boardFinished
      The boolean to keep track of whether or not a valid board has been produced by generate()
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> cellValues
      The uninitialised ArrayList<Integer> that contains each cells potential values for testing

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SudokuGen()
      Standard default constructor to automatically generate and populate a Sudoku board into a 2D array when called

      Triggered when all values possible in a cell have been used - calls the solveCell(int, int, boolean) method on the previous cell and passes the firstTry bool as false to indicate the cell is being visited at least once more.

      Part of the Sudoku solving algorithm to generate a complete board before reducing it to a game-ready board.

    • Method Detail

      • populateCellValues

        private void populateCellValues()
        Iterates 81 times to produce a full list of size 81 List<Integer> elements with randomised order using SudokuTools.shuffledNine().

      • rowValid

        private boolean rowValid​(int row,
                         int value)
        Part of the Sudoku solving algorithm to generate a complete board before reducing it to a game-ready board.
        This part handles scanning a row in the board for a given row to determine if there is any duplicity.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the Sudoku grid that needs to be checked for the specified value
        value - The value that has to be searched for in the row for duplicity
        Returns:
        A true/false for whether or not the value exists in the given row

      • columnValid

        private boolean columnValid​(int col,
                            int value)
        Part of the Sudoku solving algorithm to generate a complete board before reducing it to a game-ready board.
        This part handles scanning a column (col) in the board for a given value to determine if there is any duplicity.
        Parameters:
        col - The column (col) in the Sudoku grid that needs to be checked for the specified value
        value - The value that has to be searched for in the column (col) for duplicity
        Returns:
        A true/false for whether or not the value exists in the given column (col)

      • findSubSection

        private int[] findSubSection​(int row,
                             int col)
        Used to find a sub-row and sub-column position of a 3 x 3 area of cells in a Sudoku board grid, based on the row and col position of an individual cell.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the individual cell inside one of 9 sub-grid.
        col - The column of the individual cell inside one of 9 sub-grid.
        Returns:
        An int[] containing sub-row ([0]) and sub-column ([1]) position of the individual cell being searched for.

      • subsectionValid

        private boolean subsectionValid​(int row,
                                int col,
                                int value)
        Part of the Sudoku solving algorithm to generate a complete board before reducing it to a game-ready board.
        This part handles scanning a 3 x 3 sub-section in the board for a given value to determine if there is any duplicity.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the Sudoku board that contains the cell in question
        col - The column in the Sudoku board that contains the cell in question
        value - The integer value (from 1 to 9 inclusive) of the cell in question
        Returns:
        A true/false for whether or not the value exists in its subsection (determined by findSubSection(int, int)).

      • cellValid

        private boolean cellValid​(int row,
                          int col,
                          int value)
        Method to combine the boolean outputs of the three validation methods (rowValid(int, int), columnValid(int, int), subsectionValid(int, int, int)) that define the rules of a Sudoku board.
        Parameters:
        row - The row in the Sudoku board that contains the cell in question
        col - The column in the Sudoku board that contains the cell in question
        value - The integer value (from 1 to 9 inclusive) of the cell in question
        Returns:
        A true/false depending on the combined outcome of the three methods mentioned in the description.

      • getCellValues

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getCellValues​(int row,
                                                        int col)
        Gets the available values yet to be tested for a specified cell
        Parameters:
        row - The current row that the cell is part of
        col - The current column that the cell is part of
        Returns:
        The List that contains the specified cell's remaining possible values

      • setCellValues

        private void setCellValues​(int row,
                           int col,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> list)
        Updates the available values yet to be tested for a specified cell
        Parameters:
        row - The current row that the cell is part of
        col - The current column that the cell is part of
        list - The List<Integer> that is to replace the old one

      • backtrack

        private void backtrack​(int row,
                       int col)
        Triggered when all values possible in a cell have been used - calls the solveCell(int, int, boolean) method on the previous cell and passes the firstTry bool as false to indicate the cell is being visited at least once more. The opposite to nextCell(int row, int col).
        Parameters:
        row - The current row that the cell is part of
        col - The current column that the cell is part of

      • nextCell

        private void nextCell​(int row,
                      int col)
        Triggered when a legal value is found for a cell on the board. Calls the solveCell(int, int, boolean) method on the next cell and passes the firstTry boolean as true to indicate the cell is being altered for the first time. The opposite to backtrack(int row, int col).
        Parameters:
        row - The current row that the cell is part of
        col - The current column that the cell is part of

      • finalCell

        private boolean finalCell​(int row,
                          int col)
        A simple check to indicate if the cell currently being altered is the last cell on the board or not
        Parameters:
        row - The current row that that cell is part of
        col - The current column that the cell is part of
        Returns:
        true / false depending on whether the cell being altered is at position 81 (final cell)

      • solveCell

        private void solveCell​(int row,
                       int col,
                       boolean firstTry)
        The primary method of the SudokuGen class. This method recursively checks all numbers 1-9 inclusive (stored in a LinkedList and randomised with Collections.shuffle(List, Random) until it finds a valid number based on sudoku's row/column/3x3 subsection rules. If a valid number is found, it places it in the current cell and continues with nextCell(int, int) - if not, it recreates the cells number list (newly randomised) and tries the same process on the previous cell. During this, any time a number is tested for the cell (valid or invalid) it is removed from that cells number list until triggering a backtrack(int, int) when empty.
        Parameters:
        row - The row containing the cell to be tested
        col - The column containing the cell to be tested
        firstTry - Whether or not the cell to be tested is being tested for the first time (tru) or not (false)

      • generate

        private void generate()
        Method used to begin the sudoku board generation process at board position row = 0 column = 0.

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        Getter for the 2D array that represents the sudoku board
        Returns:
        int[r][c] representing the sudoku board where r = the row (y value) and c = column (x value) from top to bottom and left to right respectively

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
